title: [Neuroscience] Timely interventions for depression might lower the future risk of dementia. Overall, depressed participants who received treatment had reduced risk of dementia compared to untreated participants by about 30%.

[Neuroscience] A new study (N=41) using magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) scanner shows that teenagers with obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD) experience deficits in decision making and behavioural control, and this is linked to abnormal activity in an area of the brain called the orbitofrontal cortex (OFC)
